Package edu.cornell.gdiac.assets

Interface AssetParser<T>

All Known Implementing Classes:
FilmStripParser, FreetypeFontParser, JsonValueParser, MusicParser, MusicQueueParser, SoundEffectParser, SoundParser, TextureParser, TextureRegionParser
public interface AssetParser<T>
This interface parses an asset of type T from a JsonValue. While it is easy to make a custom
invalid @link 
AssetLoader
for any additional type of asset, the complicated part is always specifying the initialization parameters. This is where a JSON entry is idea. In addition to the file, it can specify the asset parameters. The purpose this interface is to take a JsonValue and convert it into an asset of type T. This interface works like an iterator. When reset(com.badlogic.gdx.utils.JsonValue) is called, it is assigned a new JsonValue, which represents the root of the directory structure. Each time processNext(com.badlogic.gdx.assets.AssetManager, com.badlogic.gdx.utils.ObjectMap<java.lang.String, java.lang.String>) is called, it searches for the next valid subtree (if there is one). It then adds an asset to the asset manager corresponding to the values of that subtree. In addition to creating an asset, the parser assigns proper keys to the assets. Instead of relying on file names (which is brittle as these may change), the JSON file specifies keys for each asset. This parser identifies these keys and communicates the mapping from a key to the asset file name. This interface is critical to the proper performance of AssetDirectory. Without a parser for a given type, the asset directory can still load that type manually, but it cannot automatically process the asset from a JSON entry.

    Class<T>
    getType()
    Returns the asset type generated by this parser
    boolean
    hasNext()
    Returns true if there are still assets left to generate

  • Method Details

    • getType

      Class<T> getType()
      Returns the asset type generated by this parser
      Returns:
      the asset type generated by this parser

    • reset

      void reset(com.badlogic.gdx.utils.JsonValue directory)
      Resets the parser iterator for the given directory. The value directory is assumed to be the root of a larger JSON structure. The individual assets are defined by subtrees in this structure.
      Parameters:
      directory - The JSON representation of the asset directory

    • hasNext

      boolean hasNext()
      Returns true if there are still assets left to generate
      Returns:
      true if there are still assets left to generate

    • processNext

      void processNext(com.badlogic.gdx.assets.AssetManager manager, com.badlogic.gdx.utils.ObjectMap<String,String> keymap)
      Processes the next available asset, loading it into the asset manager In addition to loading the asset into the asset manager, this method updates keymap with the key-filename assocation. This is what allows AssetDirectory.getEntry(java.lang.String, java.lang.Class<T>) to work. This method fails silently if there are no available assets to process.
      Parameters:
      manager - The asset manager to load an asset
      keymap - The mapping of JSON keys to asset file names
